alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Grand Valley; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 4:36PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 435 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from 21 miles northwest of Fruita to 20 miles northwest of Nucla to near Monticello and moving southeast at 40 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Grand Junction, Monticello, Fruita, Dove Creek, Nucla, Naturita, Eastland, Slick Rock, Redvale, Vancorum, Glade Park, Loma, Gateway, Ucolo, Orchard Mesa, Uravan, Cahone, Egnar, Paradox and Fruitvale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 38. Interstate 70 in Utah near mile marker 231. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 51. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 56 and 87. U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 40 and 69. U.S. Highway 491 in Utah between mile markers 0 and 17. Colorado 90 between mile markers 1 and 33. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 11. Colorado 141 between mile markers 1 and 162. Colorado 145 between mile markers 103 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
